block.p: A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around Westchester and Putnam Counties this week. Items for the guide should be sent at least three weeks in advance to westweek@nytimes.com, or by mail to Westchester Cultural Calendar, 229 West 43d Street, New York, N.Y. 10036-3959.
FILM
Mahopac ''Keeping Up With the Steins,'' directed by Scott Marshall. Jan. 20 at 7:30 p.m. Free. Temple Beth Shalom, 760 Route 6. (845) 628-6133.
Peekskill ''Backstage,'' directed by Emmanuelle Bercot. Through Jan. 14. $7 and $9. Paramount Center for the Arts, 1008 Brown Street. (914) 930-7588.

Pleasantville ''50 Years of Janus Films,'' a series of films by Bergman, Truffaut, Fellini, Kurosawa and others. Through Feb. 28. $6 to $13 per film; some films are followed by question-and-answer sessions. A schedule is available at: burnsfilmcenter.org. Jacob Burns Film Center, 364 Manville Road. (914) 773-7663.
White Plains ''In Remembrance of Martin,'' documentary honoring the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. Jan. 14 at 2:30 p.m. White Plains Public Library, 100 Martine Avenue. (914) 422-1480.
FOR CHILDREN

Ardsley Jeffrey Friedberg and the Bossy Frog Band, children's music show to benefit the Alcott School. Ages 1 to 8. Jan. 20 at 10:30 a.m. $15. Ardsley Middle School, 700 Ashford Avenue. (914) 472-4404.

Purchase ''Swimmy,'' ''Frederick'' and ''Inch by Inch,'' children's works by Leo Lionni, presented by the Mermaid Theater of Nova Scotia. Jan. 14 at 3 p.m. $14 and $20. Performing Arts Center, 735 Anderson Hill Road. (914) 251-6200.

Rye ''Stories at the Square House: Kaya From American Girl Doll,'' storytelling and crafts; presented by the Rye Historical Society. Ages 7 to 12. Jan. 20, 1 to 3 p.m. $15; reservations required. Square House Museum, 1 Purchase Street. (914) 967-7588.

Scarsdale ''Meet the Animals,'' an introduction to animal museum favorites. Jan. 14 at 2 p.m. Free and $5. ''Snowflakes Galore,'' an exploration of the world of snowflakes. Jan. 21 at 2 p.m. $2 and $5. Greenburgh Nature Center, 99 Dromore Road. (914) 723-3470.
Scarsdale ''Mad Science: Fire and Ice,'' family science workshops, ages 4 and up. Monday at 1 p.m. $15. JCC of Mid-Westchester, 999 Wilmot Road. (914) 472-3300.
Somers ''Winter Fun for Families,'' crafts and baked goods. Sunday, 1 to 3 p.m. Muscoot Farm, Route 100. (914) 864-7282.
Tarrytown ''JellyBean Children's Concert.'' Ages 2 to 5. Jan. 21 at 2:15 p.m. Free. JCC on the Hudson, 371 South Broadway. (914) 366-7898.
White Plains David Grover and the Big Bear Band, family concert. Jan. 21 at 1:30 p.m. $15 to $20. Congregation Kol Ami, 252 Soundview Avenue. (914) 949-4717, Extension 103.
Yonkers ''Music and Merriment,'' children's program. Ages 1 1/2 to 5. Through June 20. Yonkers Crestwood Library, 16 Thompson Street. (914) 337-1500, Extension 360.
MUSIC AND DANCE
Beacon Howland Chamber Music Circle, works by Bach, Beethoven, Bartok and Schumann. Jan. 14 at 4 p.m. $12 and $25. Howland Cultural Center, 477 Main Street. (845) 297-9243.
Bronx Patti LaBelle. Jan. 20 at 8 p.m. $55 to $100. Lehman Center for the Performing Arts, 250 Bedford Park Boulevard West. (718) 960-8833.
Croton Falls Annual jazz concert by Houston Person, tenor saxophonist. Sunday at 7:30 p.m. $25. Schoolhouse Theater, 3 Owens Road. (914) 277-8477.

Irvington Works by Scarlatti, Mozart and Faur√©, and music for celtic harp; Emily Mitchell, harpist, and Margaret Swinchoski, flutist. Jan. 21 at 4 p.m. Free. Irvington Public Library, 12 South Astor Street. (914) 591-7840.
Mahopac Gilbert and Sullivan's ''Mikado,'' by the TBS Actor's Studio. Through Jan. 14. $10. Temple Beth Shalom, 760 Route 6. (845) 628-6133.
Pleasantville ''Robert Stallman and Friends,'' sonatas by Bach, presented by the Pleasantville Chamber Music Society. Jan. 21 at 3 p.m. Free. Presbyterian Church, 400 Bedford Road. (914) 769-1782.

Scarsdale HB Artist Series: Lani King Chang, violinist, with Jenny Hayden, soprano; Michael Finckel, cello; and Edmund Niemann, piano. Jan. 14 at 4 p.m. $11 to $13. Scarsdale Community Baptist Church, Popham and Autenrieth Roads. (914) 723-1169.
Valhalla Saint Petersburg Classic Ballet. Jan. 21 at 3 p.m. $10 to $20. Fine Arts Gallery, 75 Grasslands Road. (914) 606-6262.

White Plains ''Brass Classics,'' works by Gabrieli, Bach, Pezel and others; members of the Westchester Philharmonic. Friday at 6:45 p.m. $10 to $20. Arts Exchange, 31 Mamaroneck Avenue. (914) 428-4220, Extension 273.
White Plains ''Twentieth Century English Music for Solo Viola,'' Vincent Lonti, violist. Wednesday at 12:10 p.m. Free. Grace Church, 33 Church Street. (914) 949-2478.
THEATER
Chappaqua ''Cinderella,'' musical presented by the students of Amadeus Conservatory of Music. Jan. 21 at 1:30 and 3 p.m. $5 and $7. Chappaqua Library, 195 South Greeley Avenue. (914) 238-0388.
Elmsford ''Footloose,'' presented by the Young Artists Repertory Company. Monday and Tuesday at 8 p.m. $20 to $40. Westchester Broadway Theater, 75 Clearbrook Road. (914) 592-2222.
Pawling ''The Heidi Chronicles,'' drama by Wendy Wasserstein, presented by the Pawling Theater Company. Through Jan. 27. $11 to $15. Pawling High School, Reservoir Road. (845) 855-1965.
Pleasantville ''Salome,'' staged reading and talk back with the audience. Jan. 14 at 2 p.m. Mount Pleasant Public Library, 350 Bedford Road. (914) 769-0548.

Rye Andrew Lloyd Weber's ''Cats,'' musical presented by students of Amadeus Conservatory of Music. Friday at 7 p.m.; Jan. 20 at 2 p.m. $12 and $16. Osborn Elementary School, 10 Osborn Road. (914) 238-0388.
Tarrytown ''The Wizard of Oz,'' presented by Music in Chappaqua and the Saw Mill Summer Theater. Jan. 20 and Jan. 21. $15 and $18. Tarrytown Music Hall, 13 Main Street. (914) 631-3390.

White Plains ''Guys and Dolls,'' musical by Abe Burrows and Jo Swerling; presented by the Play Group Theater. Through Jan. 14. $15. ''The Secret Garden,'' musical adapted from the Frances Hodgson Burnett novel; book and lyrics by Marsha Norman, music by Lucy Simon, presented by the Play Group Theater. Monday through Jan. 21. $15. White Plains Performing Arts Center, 11 City Place. (914) 328-1600.
SPOKEN WORD
Sleepy Hollow Reading by Patricia Smith and other performance poets. Jan. 21 at 4:30 p.m. Free. Hudson Valley Writers' Center, 300 Riverside Drive. (914) 332-5953.
MUSEUMS AND GALLERIES

Armonk ''Winter Solstice V: Expressions of Our Time and Place,'' group show. Through Jan. 28. Hours: Saturdays and Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. The Studio: An Alternative Space for Contemporary Art, 2 Maryland Avenue. (914) 273-1452.
Beacon ''bau 25: bau NOW,'' group exhibition of sculpture, painting and mixed media. Hours: Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 6 p.m. Beacon Artists Union (bau), 161 Main Street. (845) 440-7584.
Briarcliff Manor Watercolor and oil paintings by Julie Anello. Through Jan. 27. Hours: Wednesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Images Art Gallery, 1157 Pleasantville Road. (914) 762-3000.

Bronx ''Celebrating Winter Through Nature,'' contemporary artworks. Through Jan. 14. $2 to $4; members and under 6, free; free for everyone on Tuesdays and on Saturdays from 9 a.m. to noon. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 10 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. Wave Hill, 675 West 252nd Street. (718) 549-3200.
Greenburgh ''Captured Energy,'' student paintings and batik prints inspired by energy conservation. Through June. Free. Greenburgh Town Hall, 177 Hillside Avenue. (914) 993-1649.
Greenburgh Watercolors by students of Brigitte Loritz. Through Jan. 31. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. Madeleine Gutman Gallery, 177 Hillside Avenue. (914) 682-1574.

Harrison ''A few of my favorite things,'' watercolors by Caty Kendall. Through Jan. 26. Hours: Mondays and Wednesdays, 9:30 a.m. to 9 p.m.; Tuesdays, Thursdays and Fridays, to 5:30 p.m.; Saturdays, to 12:30 p.m. Harrison Public Library, Bruce Avenue. (914) 835-0324.
Hartsdale DeSanti Plaza Sculpture Project: ''Tinted Reflections II,'' sculpture by Anthony Krauss. Through March 1. DeSanti Plaza, across from Metro-North. (914) 478-4630.

Hyde Park ''Simple and Direct,'' photo exhibition on Mrs. Roosevelt's life at Hyde Park. Through Nov. 30. Hours: Thursdays through Mondays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. Eleanor Roosevelt Historic Site (Val-Kill), Route 9G.
Katonah ''Paterson II,'' photography by George Tice. Free. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Sundays, 11 a.m. to 4 p.m. Candace Dwan Gallery, 27 Katonah Avenue. (914) 232-3966.

Katonah ''Michael Krondl: Rising Water, Falling Water,'' photographic mural. Through March 8. Sculpture by Michael Steiner. Through April 22. Admission: $5, $3 for seniors and students. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Katonah Museum of Art, Route 22 at Jay Street. (914) 232-9555.

Larchmont ''Just a Moment,'' photography by Sid Hecker. Hours: Mondays and Thursdays, 9 a.m. to 9 p.m.; Tuesdays and Wednesdays, 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Fridays and Saturdays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Larchmont Public Library, 121 Larchmont Avenue. (914) 834-2281.

Larchmont ''Young Artists on the Rise,'' group show of work from Mamaroneck and New Rochelle high school students. Reception: Thursday, 5 to 7 p.m. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, noon to 5 p.m. Mamaroneck Artists Guild, 2120 Boston Post Road. (914) 834-1117.

New Rochelle ''Racing on a Broken Road,'' exhibit on the Underground Railroad. Through March 4. Hours: Tuesdays and Wednesdays, 10 a.m. to 8 p.m.; Thursdays and Fridays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. Castle Gallery, 29 Castle Place. (914) 654-5423.

New Rochelle ''Remembering the New York-Westchester-Boston Railway in New Rochelle,'' artifacts, maps and photographs. Hours: Mondays, Tuesdays and Thursdays, 9 a.m. to 8 p.m.; Wednesdays, 10 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Fridays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. New Rochelle Public Library, Lawton Street. (914) 632-7878.
Newburgh Decorative works curated by Elizabeth Oliver. Through Feb. 25. Yellow Bird Gallery, 19 Front Street. (845) 561-7204.

Peekskill ''Only the Paranoid Survive,'' works focusing on the ''culture of fear,'' curated by Daniel Fuller. Through Jan. 21. $5, adults; $1, children; members, free. Hours: Saturdays and Sundays, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m.; group tours available by appointment. Hudson Valley Center for Contemporary Art, 1701 Main Street. (914) 788-7166.
Port Chester ''Pollinia,'' ceramic sculpture by Leigh Taylor Mickelson. Through Jan. 27. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. Clay Art Center, 40 Beech Street. (914) 937-2047.

Purchase ''Crossing the Boulevard: Strangers, Neighbors, Aliens in a New America.'' Through Jan. 27. $3 to $5; members and children 12 and under, free. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Neuberger Museum of Art, 735 Anderson Hill Road. (914) 251-6100.
Rye ''Cutting Across Cultures: The Art of Papercutting, Then and Now,'' works by traditional and contemporary paper-cutting artists. Through Feb. 17. Rye Arts Center, 51 Milton Road. (914) 967-0700.
Rye ''The Image Makers,'' works by members of the Westchester Photographic Society. Through Feb. 16. Rye Free Reading Room, 1061 Boston Post Road. (914) 967-0480.
Rye ''Shells and Trees,'' works by Elasah Schaff. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Rye Nature Center, 873 Boston Post Road. (914) 967-5150.

Scarsdale ''Turning Points: Documents That Shaped America,'' historical documents. Through Jan. 20. $1.50 to $2; members, free. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Scarsdale Historical Society Museum, 937 White Plains Post Road. (914) 723-1744.
Valhalla ''Looser, Smoother, Faster,'' works by Eric Hongisto, Shoji Kato and Matt King. Tuesday through Feb. 24. Fine Arts Gallery, 75 Grasslands Road. (914) 606-7867.

West Point ''The Color of Loyalty: A Tribute to Dr. J. Robert Oppenheimer,'' works by Linda Jean Fisher. Through Feb. 11. Hours: Daily, 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. 1929 Gallery, Eisenhower Hall, United States Military Academy. (845) 938-2782.

White Plains ''Once Upon a Time The Art of Children's Book Illustration,'' work of Howard Fine, Yumi Heo and Mary O'Keefe Young, with family storytimes and demonstrations by the artists Jan. 14 at 2 p.m. Through Feb. 28. Free. White Plains Public Library, 100 Martine Avenue. (914) 422-1480.
Woodstock ''Nature Without Glass,'' pinhole photographs by Mark Stetler. Through Feb. 12. Hours: Thursdays through Mondays, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m. Gallery B.M.G., 12 Tannery Brook Road. (845) 679-0027.

Somers ''Winter Fun for Families,'' crafts and baked goods. Sunday, 1 to 3 p.m. Muscoot Farm, Route 100. (914) 864-7282.

Yonkers ''Music and Merriment,'' children's program. Ages 1 1/2 to 5. Through June 20. Yonkers Crestwood Library, 16 Thompson Street. (914) 337-1500, Extension 360.

Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Katonah Museum of Art, Route 22 at Jay Street. (914) 232-9555.
